properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:15 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-01T05:10:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T02:44:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3256294643.2019
Area: Clearwater Co. near Rocky Mtn House and Crimson Lake, Lacombe Co. near Eckville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:49 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. At 9:45 pm, radar showed three severe thunderstorms, one south of Manitou near the US border, another just southeast of Portage La Prairie, and a new one just north of Winkler. The thunderstorm that gave nickel sized hail to Elie is now weakening, so any severe thunderstorms should pass to the southwest of Winnipeg. All thunderstorms are tracking east to southeast at 20 to 30 km/h. Golf ball sized hail was reported on the thunderstorm southeast of Portage La Prairie. Localized flooding is also a concern due to the slow motion of these thunderstorms. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-01T05:34:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T02:50:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0613511897.2019
Area: Mun. of Pembina incl. Manitou La Rivière and Snowflake, R.M. of Portage la Prairie incl. St. Ambroise, R.M. of Cartier incl. Elie St. Eustache and Springstein, R.M. of Grey incl. St. Claude Elm Creek and Fannystelle, R.M. of Dufferin incl. Carman Roseisle and Homewood, R.M. of Macdonald incl. Brunkild Starbuck and La Salle, R.M. of Roland incl. Jordan and Myrtle, R.M. of Stanley incl. Winkler and Morden
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots. Several areas of thunderstorms over Gulf-Magdalen may have the potential to give gale force wind gusts up to 35 kts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-08-01T08:14:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T01:12:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4045256215.2019
Area: Gulf - Magdalen
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Near zero visibilities in fog will continue into Thursday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-01T18:04:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T02:05:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3624932156.2019
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 10:37 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A line of thunderstorms on a northeast to southwest line from south of Dallas to east of Camper is currently tracking to the southeast at 30 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-01T06:18:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T03:38:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3994544716.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:38 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A thunderstorm about 15 km north of Chipman is moving East Northeast at about 60 km/h. Doppler radar indicates that extreme damaging wind between 90 km/h and 110 km/h will affect the area over the next 90 minutes. Locations impacted include: Saint-Joseph (Parish), Harcourt (Parish) and Richibucto 15. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-01T05:28:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T02:39:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1591337044.2019
Area: Grand Lake and Queens County, Kent County
